org.jogamp.glg2d

Interface PathVisitor

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ShaderPathVisitor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTesselatorVisitor, BasicStrokeLineVisitor, CollectingTesselator, FastLineVisitor, FillSimpleConvexPolygonVisitor, GL2ES2SimpleConvexFillVisitor, GL2ES2StrokeLineVisitor, GL2ES2TesselatingVisitor, GL2GL3StrokeLineVisitor, GL2TesselatorVisitor, LineDrawingVisitor, SimpleOrTesselatingVisitor, SimplePathVisitor, TriangleStripTesselator

    public interface PathVisitor
    Receives the calls from a PathIterator and draws the shape as it is visited. The form of this interface and the documentation closely mirror that class.

    Note: The implementation should assume that the array being passed into each of these calls is being modified when the call returns, the vertex array is recycled and any storage of the points should guard against external mutation.

    See Also:
    PathIterator

    • Method Detail

      • setGLContext

        void setGLContext(GL context)
        Sets the GL context to be used for the next drawing session.
        Parameters:
        context - The GL context

      • setStroke

        void setStroke(BasicStroke stroke)
        Sets the stroke to be used when drawing a path. It's not needed for visitors that fill.

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(float[] vertex)
        Specifies the starting location for a new subpath.
        Parameters:
        vertex - An array where the first two values are the x,y coordinates of the start of the subpath.

      • lineTo

        void lineTo(float[] vertex)
        Specifies the end point of a line to be drawn from the most recently specified point.
        Parameters:
        vertex - An array where the first two values are the x,y coordinates of the next point in the subpath.

      • quadTo

        void quadTo(float[] previousVertex,
          float[] control)
        Specifies a quadratic parametric curve is to be drawn. The curve is interpolated by solving the parametric control equation in the range (t=[0..1]) using the previous point (CP), the first control point (P1), and the final interpolated control point (P2). The parametric control equation for this curve is: 
                  P(t) = B(2,0)*CP + B(2,1)*P1 + B(2,2)*P2
          0 <= t <= 1
 
        B(n,m) = mth coefficient of nth degree Bernstein polynomial
               = C(n,m) * t^(m) * (1 - t)^(n-m)
        C(n,m) = Combinations of n things, taken m at a time
               = n! / (m! * (n-m)!)
        Parameters:
        previousVertex - The first control point. The same as the most recent specified vertex.
        control - The control point and the second vertex, in order.

      • cubicTo

        void cubicTo(float[] previousVertex,
           float[] control)
        Specifies a cubic parametric curve to be drawn. The curve is interpolated by solving the parametric control equation in the range (t=[0..1]) using the previous point (CP), the first control point (P1), the second control point (P2), and the final interpolated control point (P3). The parametric control equation for this curve is: 
                  P(t) = B(3,0)*CP + B(3,1)*P1 + B(3,2)*P2 + B(3,3)*P3
          0 <= t <= 1
 
        B(n,m) = mth coefficient of nth degree Bernstein polynomial
               = C(n,m) * t^(m) * (1 - t)^(n-m)
        C(n,m) = Combinations of n things, taken m at a time
               = n! / (m! * (n-m)!)
        This form of curve is commonly known as a Bézier curve.
        Parameters:
        previousVertex - The first control point. The same as the most recent specified vertex.
        control - The two control points and the second vertex, in order.

      • closeLine

        void closeLine()
        Specifies that the preceding subpath should be closed by appending a line segment back to the point corresponding to the most recent call to #moveTo(float[]).

      • beginPoly

        void beginPoly(int windingRule)
        Starts the polygon or polyline.
        Parameters:
        windingRule - The winding rule for the polygon.

      • endPoly

        void endPoly()
        Signifies that the polygon or polyline has ended. All cleanup should occur and there will be no more calls for this shape.
